thread.title: IPO pipeline for 2025 looks staggering, get ready for another record year
thread.title_full: IPO pipeline for 2025 looks staggering, get ready for another record year

author: Moneycontrol News
title: IPO pipeline for 2025 looks staggering, get ready for another record year
text: The year 2025 is promising to be another record year for IPOs in India, with close to Rs 1.80 lakh crore worth of public issues already in possession of Sebi approval, or are awaiting nod, data from Prime Database has showed. The pipeline this year comprises of 28 companies that are looking to raise as much Rs 46,000 crore, after capital market regulator approved their public issues. Another 80 companies have sought to raise about Rs 1.32 lakh crore and are awaiting approval. The year gone by was a massive success for SME public issues, cumulatively raising Rs 8,761 crore, which is 87% higher than 2023. The average issue of SME IPOs too has seen a six-fold rise in four years to Rs 36 crore last year, said Prime Database. The retail investor participated in these SME offerings with high interest, reflecting in the average number of retail applications increased to 1.88 lakh, as compared to only 297 in 2020. QIPs too were among the preferred mode of fund raise, with a three-fold rise in mobilization as 99 companies raised Rs 1,38 lakh crore in 2024 through this route. The largest QIPs last year were from Vedanta & Zomato, raising Rs 8,500 crore each. One will have to see if the Centre taps the market to offload stake in PSUs this year, after 2024 saw OFS of NHPC, NLC, GIC and Cochin Shipyard, raising Rs 8,947 crore as divestment proceeds. On the whole, 91 companies raised Rs 1.60 lakh crore through main board IPOs in 2024, which is a three-fold rise from Rs 49,436 crore raised in 2023 through 57 IPOs. The rising participation raised the average deal size by two-folds Rs 1,756 crore, showed the data. New age consumer tech companies were back with a bag on the IPO street with eight IPOs, including the likes of Awfis, Firstcry, Mobikwik, Swiggy and Unicommerce raising Rs 21,438 crore. The amount of fresh capital raised in 2024 through initial public offerings was Rs 64,499 crore, or 40 per cent of the total sum raised. The level of retail interest IPOs too was very encouraging, with 66 out of 91 IPOs of 2024 getting more than 10 times subscription, and 10 IPOs were oversubscribed more than three times, showed the data. The retail caterogy saw bids worth Rs 3.40 lakh crore for shares on offer, which was 113% more than total IPO mobilisation for the year, capturing the enthusiasm for fresh paper. Across categories, the average oversubscription was at 45.39x, and average retail oversubscription at 34.15x, both higher than 2023, underscoring the investor enthusiasm. This was further backed by strong listings, with average listing gain rising to 30.25% in comparison to 28.68% in 2023. As of Januray 9, as many as 65 of the 91 IPOs of 2024 were trading above the issue price, but the average gain from these 91 issues is over 44%, showed numbers from Prime Database.
